Comment: A new poll from the Hoover Institution’s [Fiscal Policy Initiative](https://www.hoover.org/research-teams/fiscal-policy-initiative) asked 1,775 members of the American public about their attitudes toward the extension of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act (TCJA, or the “Trump Tax Cuts”) currently being negotiated in Congress. Conducted with YouGov on April 4–10, 2025, the survey revealed that while Americans are worried about future federal debt and deficits, they have large gaps in knowledge about what the federal government spends money on and what is included in the extension of the 2017 TCJA that is currently being negotiated by Congress. Of those polled, 75% are concerned about the growing federal debt and believe Congress should prioritize deficit reduction, yet only 17% correctly identify Social Security as the largest federal spending program. Knowledge about the TCJA is remarkably low, with only 11% of respondents answering at least 7 of 10 questions about it correctly, and 54% getting only 3 or fewer questions right.
